title: The French government announces reinforcements to fight fires
description: Facing a worrying level of drought nationwide, French authoroties announced the deployment of nine new water bomber planes and helicopters along with nearly 500 additional firefighters.

title: 'If it is not careful, Europe risks becoming a union of failed regions'
description: While Europe is facing a delicate energy transition, the gap is dangerously widening between the dynamic cities and regions of the South and East, Marie Charrel, a columnist at 'Le Monde', observes.

title: Champions League: Madrid dominates 10-man Chelsea as Milan edges Napoli
description: Karim Benzema scored the opening goal for the home side in their comfortable win against struggling Chelsea as Ismael Bennacer gave AC Milan a slim advantage in their all-Italian quarter-final against Napoli.

title: US Judge believes Fox News might have withheld evidence in defamation lawsuit
description: Dominion alleges that Fox damaged the company by repeatedly airing false allegations that its machines and the software they used rigged the 2020 presidential election to prevent Trump’s re-election. The trial is scheduled to start Thursday with jury selection.

title: Macron insists Europe won't be US 'vassal' on Taiwan
description: The French president on Wednesday appeared to stand by the statements he made in an interview at the weekend over Europe's position on Taiwan.

title: War in Ukraine: Since 2014, women have made their way into the military
description: According to the Ministry of Defense, 41,000 women serve in the army, with 5,000 in combat positions. This is the result of nearly a decade of struggle to have their role recognized.

title: Beijing and Moscow dominate global nuclear energy trade
description: Of the 59 reactors under construction worldwide, 43 are of Russian or Chinese design.

title: Depardieu accused of sexual violence by 13 more women
description: New allegations spanning over two decades have been made against the 74-year-old French film actor, joining earlier accusations that he had raped another young French actress.

title: US broadcaster NPR quits Twitter over 'government-funded' label
description: The radio broadcaster said that the label undermined its credibility "by falsely implying that we are not editorially independent."

title: United States tumbles into toxic debt
description: Rising interest rates are destabilizing small banks, struggling companies can no longer obtain financing and the real estate sector is suffering massively in the current climate.

title: Stellantis tries to justify pay package of CEO Tavares
description: The carmaker's shareholders will be consulted on the CEO's remuneration at a general meeting to be held on Thursday.

title: The Tunisian TV show that has thrown the country's education community into turmoil
description: Drugs, violence, unruliness... According to its detractors, the Tunisian high school TV show 'Fallujah' exaggerates the difficulties faced by some schools.

title: US weakened by leak of Pentagon documents
description: The White House implied – without confirming it – that the classified material, which was released on the internet, was authentic.

title: Biden urges Northern Ireland politicians to 'keep the peace' and restore power-sharing
description: During a visit to Belfast, the US president also highlighted the 'unlimited' economic possibilities in the UK-ruled territory that shares a land border with the Republic of Ireland.

title: On China visit, Lula wants to bring Beijing closer to Brasilia
description: The Brazilian president hopes to get Xi Jinping to play a leadership role in resolving the war in Ukraine. For his part, the Chinese leader wants to get Lula to join China's 'Belt and Road Initiative.'

title: France's left-wing alliance in dire need of introspection
description: The NUPES' internal divisions are preventing it from taking advantage of the opposition against the French pension reform.

title: IMF: With persistent high inflation, eurozone growth will stall in 2023
description: Global growth is expected to slow this year, coupled with inflation that remains well above central bank targets, according to the International Monetary Fund's latest forecast.

title: Leaked Pentagon documents: What we know about their authenticity
description: Several dozen photographs, supposedly showing excerpts from confidential reports produced by the US on the war in Ukraine, have been posted online since the beginning of March.

title: China praises Macron's 'brilliant' Taiwan comments
description: The French president sowed confusion and division with European allies when he called for Europe not to 'follow' US policy on Taiwan.

title: Dutch police detain protesters who ran at Macron during state visit
description: The latest incident during the French president's trip to the Netherlands came a day after demonstrators disrupted his speech at The Hague.

title: Xi says China must step up training for 'actual combat'
description: The Chinese President's remarks came a day after China held large-scale exercises off the coast of Taiwan.

title: Shamshad, the French clandestine operation deployed in Afghanistan from 2009 to 2020
description: The intelligence gathering work carried out by this Franco-Afghan operation intensified after the departure of French soldiers, ordered by former president François Hollande in 2012.

title: The bitterness of former Afghan spies who worked for France
description: Several dozen members of the intelligence services of the former regime in Kabul collaborated with France's secret service between 2009 and 2020. After the Taliban took power in 2021, only a minority were expatriated to France.

title: Ukraine's Zelensky blasts Russian 'beasts' after alleged POW beheading video
description: The footage, which has not yet been verified, circulated on social media on Wednesday.

title: 'Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves,' a spectacular makeshift heroic fantasy
description: In this new adaptation of the famous role-playing game, a band of misfits searches for a lost relic.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: The opening ceremony in 5 questions
description: On Wednesday, there will be a presentation of the artistic vision for the event to the International Olympic Committee. Although the outlines of the inaugural celebration are taking shape, several questions still remain unanswered.

title: Moscow amends law to facilitate new wave of mobilization
description: Draft notices can now be sent electronically and not only in the form of a hand-delivered piece of paper, making it impossible to dodge conscription.

title: 'Strategic autonomy is both in Macron's European DNA and his most divisive battle'
description: While the war in Ukraine has strengthened the transatlantic alliance, the French president is renewing his fight to reduce Europe's dependence. It is a battle not yet won.

title: Theranos' Holmes loses bid to stay out of prison
description: In an 11-page ruling issued on Monday, United States District Judge Edward Davila concluded there was not compelling enough evidence to allow Holmes to remain free on bail.

title: Mumbai, the multifaceted megalopolis symbolizing Indian ambition
description: '1.4 billion Indians' (2/3).Juxtaposing opulence and poverty, ambitious construction projects and environmental disasters, Mumbai mirrors the paradoxes and aspirations of an entire people.

title: The French army finally adopts a climate strategy
description: A year ago, France adopted a 'climate and defense' strategy, yet the armed forces, cagey about their operations, are not willing to be more transparent about their greenhouse gas emissions.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: The Russian presence needs to be clarified now
description: The IOC, which continues to defend the return of Russian and Belarusian athletes in international competitions, postponed its decision for the Olympic and Paralympic Games in Paris.

title: Myanmar: Ruling junta conducts deadly air strikes on village drawing international condemnation
description: The death toll from the early morning strike on the remote Kanbalu township in the central Sagaing region remains unclear though some fear it may have killed as many as 100 people including many children.

title: The Taiwan question will dominate Xi Jinping's third term
description: The recent military drills by China around the 'rebel' island – in response to Taiwanese president's meeting in the US – indicate Beijin's desire to test red lines, rather than cross them.

title: Joe Biden arrives in Northern Ireland to support fragile peace and address post-Brexit trade issues
description: The US president, of Irish descent, arrived in Belfast on Tuesday to commemorate the 25th anniversary of the Good Friday Agreement, signed in April 1998.

title: The head of the leading British employers' association is sacked after accusations of sexual harassment
description: The Confederation of British Industry's Director General, Tony Danker, has been dismissed with immediate effect.
